example.name: transitive
example.text: [The water]-1 destroyed about $ 75 million [*U*] in currency and caked $ 4 million [*U*] of coins with mud , [*]-1 rendering them dangerous to counting machines .

example.name: passive
example.text: Naturally , neither General Dynamics nor Dassault could be expected to hamper its prospective future dealings by making disclosures of sums paid ( or not ) to various Greek officials for services-1 rendered [*]-1 .

example.name: all arguments
example.text: [*-1] Assuming [0] modern audiences readily understand that Moliere 's social indictment covers their world as well as 17th-century Paris , [Mr. Wilbur]-1 concentrated his formidable artistry on [*-1] rendering the Alexandrine French verse into sprightly and theatrical English iambic pentameter .
example.arg: into sprightly and theatrical English iambic pentameter

example.name: art frame
example.text: In this early example of Indian painting in an Ajanta cave, the artist rendered the sensuous form of the richly attired bodhisattva with gentle gradations of color and delicate highlights and shadows .
example.arg: In this early example of Indian painting in an Ajanta cave
the sensuous form of the richly attired bodhisattva
with gentle gradations of color and delicate highlights and shadows

predicate.note: Also a member of Vncls cheat-10.6, but this seems not to fit with any of the current senses. If you see such an example, it probably needs to be a new sense.

frameset.note: frames created by Olga. Frames file for 'render' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.
